nav.div: McGregor ISD » Coronavirus » Student & Family Wellness

br.span:
COVID-19 is an unprecedented situation, and one that many us of may not know how to deal with or talk about. Please use these outside resources for yourself and your family during this situation. If you or your student wish to speak with one of our school counselors, please see their contact information below.
Amanda Cooper, Primary Counselor
Eunice Boedeker, Elementary Counselor
Brooke Crisp, Jr. High Counselor
Laronda Clark, High School Counselor

a.title: What to Do if You're Sick

img.alt: WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE SICK
img.title: WHAT TO DO IF YOU ARE SICK

strong.style: font-size: medium; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: Tahoma;

br.span: Visit the Texas COVID-19 webpage for helpful information regarding the Coronavirus and what you can do to keep your family and others safe!

p.style: box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: "Open Sans", apple-system, blinkmacsystemfont, "Segoe UI", "Helvetica Neue", arial, sans-serif;

span.br: The CDC has launched Life is Better with Clean Hands, a national campaign encouraging adults to make clean hands a healthy habit at home and away.

p.style: box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: "Open Sans", apple-system, blinkmacsystemfont, "Segoe UI", "Helvetica Neue", arial, sans-serif;
p.span: Washing your hands is easy, and it’s one of the most effective ways to prevent the spread of germs.
Follow these five steps every time.

ol.style: box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; padding-left: 25px; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: "Open Sans", apple-system, blinkmacsystemfont, "Segoe UI", "Helvetica Neue", arial, sans-serif;

li.span: Wet your hands with clean, running water (warm or cold), turn off the tap, and apply soap.
Lather your hands by rubbing them together with the soap. Lather the backs of your hands, between your fingers, and under your nails.
Scrub your hands for at least 20 seconds. Need a timer? Hum the “Happy Birthday” song from beginning to end twice.
Rinse your hands well under clean, running water.
Dry your hands using a clean towel or air dry them.

p.style: box-sizing: border-box; margin-top: 0px; margin-bottom: 1rem; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: "Open Sans", apple-system, blinkmacsystemfont, "Segoe UI", "Helvetica Neue", arial, sans-serif;
p.span: If soap and water aren’t available, you can use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol.
